hero.question: US strikes Iran by February 27, 2026?
hero.prob_take: Traders are now pricing in less than a 4% chance of US strikes on Iran by late February, down sharply from yesterday's 13.4% as tensions appear to be cooling. The real tell will be any escalation in the Middle East over the next 6 weeks, since this market tends to spike on headline risk before settling back down.

daily_take.headline: Iran Strike Odds Crater as Markets Price Out Imminent Escalation
daily_take.deck: The odds on a US strike against Iran have collapsed from 13.4% to 3.8% in 24 hours, a stunning reversal that suggests traders are betting the window for military action is closing. The drop tracks with recent diplomatic signals and the simple fact that February has 14 days left. When an outcome becomes mathematically harder, the market corrects fast.

sidebar.headline: Russia's Pokrovsk grind looks inevitable at 96% odds, but markets underestimated Ukrainian resilience before.
sidebar.label: Pokrovsk Capture: 96.3%

sidebar.headline: Rockets favored at 72% but 56-point crash suggests sharp money just got bullish on the spread.
sidebar.label: Rockets -15.5: 72%

sidebar.headline: Government shutdown odds frozen at 64% because Washington's ability to surprise is the only real constant.
sidebar.label: Shutdown Past 3/29: 63.5%
